title: The Portrait of a Lady - stylistic difference

content.question: Mr. Touchett’s reflections on his marriage in the fourteenth and fifteenth sentences (“It struck her husband . . . so terribly consistent”) indicate that, unlike Mrs. Touchett, he

choices.label: has strong reservations about their living arrangements
is more interested in his work than in his family
looks forward to reuniting the family in Florence

content.answer: has strong reservations about their living arrangements

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain the function of contrasts within a text.
